result.markdown:
---
title: "ANOVA"
format: html

execute: 
  freeze: auto
  cache: true
  warning: false
---


## Quando temos mais de 2 tratamentos utilizamos Anova.

# definição de P value: é probabilidade de obter o valor encontrado, ou maior que ele 
dada hipótese nula. 

***ESTUDAR :alternativa do teste wilcox e mannwhiltney***


::: {.cell hash='aula10_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_9b1736a120675e942bcfacdb1af738eb'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(agricolae)
library(readxl)
library(tidyverse)

micelial <- read_excel("dados-diversos.xlsx", "micelial")
```
:::


### modelo


::: {.cell hash='aula10_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_448bbec6877b307609d454db95127ac6'}

```{.r .cell-code}
aov1 <- aov(tcm~especie, data = micelial)
summary(aov1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
            Df Sum Sq Mean Sq F value Pr(>F)
especie      4 0.4692 0.11729   1.983  0.117
Residuals   37 2.1885 0.05915               
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
library(performance)
check_heteroscedasticity(aov1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
OK: Error variance appears to be homoscedastic (p = 0.175).
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
library(DHARMa)
plot(simulateResiduals(aov1))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](aula10_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-2-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='aula10_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_588f45b1b71504d6affd85aac404b147'}

```{.r .cell-code}
insects <- tbl_df(InsectSprays)
dat1 <- insects |> 
  ggplot(aes(spray, count))+
  geom_boxplot()
aov2 <- aov(sqrt(count)~spray, data = insects)
summary(aov2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
            Df Sum Sq Mean Sq F value Pr(>F)    
spray        5  88.44  17.688    44.8 <2e-16 ***
Residuals   66  26.06   0.395                   
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
check_normality(aov2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
OK: residuals appear as normally distributed (p = 0.681).
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
check_heteroscedasticity(aov2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
OK: Error variance appears to be homoscedastic (p = 0.854).
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
library(emmeans)

aov2_means <- emmeans(aov2, ~spray,
                      type = "response")
aov2_means
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
 spray response    SE df lower.CL upper.CL
 A        14.14 1.364 66   11.550    17.00
 B        15.03 1.406 66   12.352    17.97
 C         1.55 0.452 66    0.779     2.58
 D         4.68 0.785 66    3.248     6.38
 E         3.27 0.656 66    2.095     4.72
 F        16.15 1.458 66   13.370    19.19

Confidence level used: 0.95 
Intervals are back-transformed from the sqrt scale 
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
pwpm(aov2_means)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
        A       B       C       D       E       F
A [14.14]  0.9975  <.0001  <.0001  <.0001  0.9145
B  -0.116 [15.03]  <.0001  <.0001  <.0001  0.9936
C   2.516   2.632 [ 1.55]  0.0081  0.2513  <.0001
D   1.596   1.712  -0.919 [ 4.68]  0.7366  <.0001
E   1.951   2.067  -0.565   0.355 [ 3.27]  <.0001
F  -0.258  -0.142  -2.774  -1.854  -2.209 [16.15]

Row and column labels: spray
Upper triangle: P values   adjust = "tukey"
Diagonal: [Estimates] (response)   type = "response"
Lower triangle: Comparisons (estimate)   earlier vs. later
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
library(multcomp)
library(multcompView)

cld(aov2_means)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
 spray response    SE df lower.CL upper.CL .group
 C         1.55 0.452 66    0.779     2.58  1    
 E         3.27 0.656 66    2.095     4.72  12   
 D         4.68 0.785 66    3.248     6.38   2   
 A        14.14 1.364 66   11.550    17.00    3  
 B        15.03 1.406 66   12.352    17.97    3  
 F        16.15 1.458 66   13.370    19.19    3  

Confidence level used: 0.95 
Intervals are back-transformed from the sqrt scale 
Note: contrasts are still on the sqrt scale 
P value adjustment: tukey method for comparing a family of 6 estimates 
significance level used: alpha = 0.05 
NOTE: If two or more means share the same grouping symbol,
      then we cannot show them to be different.
      But we also did not show them to be the same. 
```
:::
:::


## Ajustando modelo aplicando SQRT. podemos também usar log ou (logX + 0.05)


::: {.cell hash='aula10_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-4_db99762dbe343f7b21023e2c5e52918f'}

```{.r .cell-code}
aov2 <- aov(count~spray, data =insects)
summary(aov2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
            Df Sum Sq Mean Sq F value Pr(>F)    
spray        5   2669   533.8    34.7 <2e-16 ***
Residuals   66   1015    15.4                   
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
check_normality(aov2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Warning: Non-normality of residuals detected (p = 0.022).
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
check_heteroscedasticity(aov2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Warning: Heteroscedasticity (non-constant error variance) detected (p < .001).
```
:::
:::


### OPTANDO POR TESTE NAO PARAMETRICO


::: {.cell hash='aula10_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-5_9f708d56fec5d54171922599d6593f3e'}

```{.r .cell-code}
kruskal.test(count~spray, data = insects)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Kruskal-Wallis rank sum test

data:  count by spray
Kruskal-Wallis chi-squared = 54.691, df = 5, p-value = 1.511e-10
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
install.packages("agricolae")
library(agricolae)

kruskal(insects$count, insects$spray,
        console = TRUE)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

Study: insects$count ~ insects$spray
Kruskal-Wallis test's
Ties or no Ties

Critical Value: 54.69134
Degrees of freedom: 5
Pvalue Chisq  : 1.510845e-10 

insects$spray,  means of the ranks

  insects.count  r
A      52.16667 12
B      54.83333 12
C      11.45833 12
D      25.58333 12
E      19.33333 12
F      55.62500 12

Post Hoc Analysis

t-Student: 1.996564
Alpha    : 0.05
Minimum Significant Difference: 8.462804 

Treatments with the same letter are not significantly different.

  insects$count groups
F      55.62500      a
B      54.83333      a
A      52.16667      a
D      25.58333      b
E      19.33333     bc
C      11.45833      c
```
:::
:::


## Modelo linear generalizado


::: {.cell hash='aula10_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-6_8d30f7c56ed32d3618983bf96b853d22'}

```{.r .cell-code}
glml <- glm(count~spray,
            data = insects,
            family = poisson(link = "identity"))

plot(simulateResiduals(glml))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](aula10_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
summary(glml)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

Call:
glm(formula = count ~ spray, family = poisson(link = "identity"), 
    data = insects)

Coefficients:
            Estimate Std. Error z value Pr(>|z|)    
(Intercept)  14.5000     1.0992  13.191  < 2e-16 ***
sprayB        0.8333     1.5767   0.529    0.597    
sprayC      -12.4167     1.1756 -10.562  < 2e-16 ***
sprayD       -9.5833     1.2720  -7.534 4.92e-14 ***
sprayE      -11.0000     1.2247  -8.981  < 2e-16 ***
sprayF        2.1667     1.6116   1.344    0.179    
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

(Dispersion parameter for poisson family taken to be 1)

    Null deviance: 409.041  on 71  degrees of freedom
Residual deviance:  98.329  on 66  degrees of freedom
AIC: 376.59

Number of Fisher Scoring iterations: 3
```
:::
:::


## modelo não PARAMETRICO


::: {.cell hash='aula10_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-7_1db2dfd3b350129c323636bae07ab3be'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
library(MASS)

insects<- InsectSprays
b<- boxcox(lm(insects$count+0.1~1))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](aula10_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-7-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
lambda <- b$x[which.max(b$y)]
lambda
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 0.4242424
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
insects$count2 <- (insects$count ^lambda - 1)/lambda
insects$count2
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

 [8]  6.557185  5.484274  6.043993  4.864268  4.640760  4.161975  5.484274
```

```{.r .cell-code}
hist(insects$count2)
```
